alert.note: Alert for Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 13 at 9:29AM MST until January 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet with locally higher amounts up to 3 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Elkhead and Park Mountains, Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys, West Elk and Sawatch Mountains and Flat Tops. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST this afternoon through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains
